    get-to-know-dbsnp tidyGWAS-workflow

    Check that values in GWAS summary statistics columns are correct

    validate_columns.Rd

    `validate_columns()` does not remove any rows, but adds a TRUE/FALSE flag for the specified column.

    Usage

    validate_columns(
  tbl,
  col = c("B", "SE", "EAF", "N", "Z", "P", "POS", "CHR", "EffectAllele", "OtherAllele"),
  verbose = TRUE,
  convert_p = 2.225074e-308
)

    Arguments

    tbl

    a tibble in [tidyGWAS_columns()] format.

    col

    Which column to check values in?

    verbose

    Should details about what is in each filter be reported?

    convert_p

    if a pvalue is equal to 0, what value should be it be replaced with? By default, the value is the smallest possible double that R can represent. When P values are smaller than this, R often reads it in as a character. This can cause issues in downstream analysis, and it is therefore recommended to deal with extremely small pvalues early on.

    Value

    a [dplyr::tibble()], with a column added named as invalid_col. If you validate the "B" column, validate_columns will add a TRUE/FALSE column named invalid_B to the input tibble.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
gwas_file <- validate_columns(
 tbl = gwas_file,
 col = "B",
 verbose = FALSE,
 # if you want to keep 0 pvalues as 0.
 convert_p = 0
)
dplyr::filter(gwas_file, invalid_P)
}
